com.ibm.avatar.algebra.datamodel

Class AbstractTupleSchema

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ibm.avatar.algebra.datamodel.AbstractTupleSchema
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<AbstractTupleSchema>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    TupleSchema

    public abstract class AbstractTupleSchema
extends Object
implements Comparable<AbstractTupleSchema>
    Object that encapsulates the shared schema of a set of tuples. Also serves as a factory for producing tuple field accessors.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors

      Constructor for AbstractTupleSchema.

        Parameters:
        i - index of the field in the schema
        Returns:
        data type of the field at the given index

      • getFieldNameByIx

        public abstract String getFieldNameByIx(int i)

        Returns:

      • getPhysicalIndex

        public abstract int getPhysicalIndex(int i)
        Returns the index of the physical field in the tuple.
        Returns:
        the index of the physical field in the tuple that is mapped to a given field of the schema

      • getLogicalIndex

        public int getLogicalIndex(int physicalIndex)
        Returns the index of the first logical field in the schema, given a physical index as returned by getPhysicalIndex(int). Note that this method is not intended to be fast.
        Parameters:
        physicalIndex - index of an actual (internal) field of the tuple, as returned by getPhysicalIndex(int)
        Returns:
        the index of the logical field in the tuple that is mapped to the indicated physical index. If there are multiple logical fields mapped to the same physical column, returns the lowest-numbered one.

        public abstract boolean equals(Object obj)
        Subclass implementation of this method MUST be kept in sync with the implementation of hashCode().
        Overrides:
        equals in class Object

      • compareTo

        public abstract int compareTo(AbstractTupleSchema o)
        Comparison function for tuple schemas. Must sort base schemas lower than derived ones.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface Comparable<AbstractTupleSchema>

      • compareWithoutRecursion

        public abstract int compareWithoutRecursion(AbstractTupleSchema o)
        A version of compareTo(AbstractTupleSchema) that will not recurse on a particular type; used to avoid infinite recursion when comparing schemas that involve Text types.
        Parameters:
        o - schema to compare against

      • getName

        public String getName()
        Return name of the schema.
        Returns:
        name of the schema. [anonymous] is returned when the schema does not have a name.

        Get the data type of a field, by field name.

      • containsField

        public boolean containsField(String fieldName)
        Check if the schema contains the given field name.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - name of a field that may or may not be in the schema
        Returns:
        true if the schema contains a field by the indicated name

      • getFieldNames

        public String[] getFieldNames()
        Returns all the field names of this schema. The returned array can be modified without affecting this schema.
        Returns:
        names of the fields in this schema, in the order that they occur

      • getFieldTypes

        public FieldType[] getFieldTypes()
        Returns all the field types for this schema. The returned array can be modified without affecting this schema.
        Returns:
        types of the fields in this schema, in the order that they occur

      • getCol

        public Object getCol(Tuple tup,
                     int fieldIx)
        This method is only for use when accessors will not suffice; e.g. when writing code that must deal with many different types of tuple from the same loop.
        Parameters:
        tup - a tuple that follows this schema
        fieldIx - index of a field in this schema
        Returns:
        the indicated field of the tuple

      • genericSetter

        public FieldSetter<Object> genericSetter(String fieldName,
                                         FieldType type)
        Create a setter that takes objects with no built-in casting to the appropriate runtime type. Java generates warnings when you use the returned object.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - the field to set
        type - the type of the objects you pass to the setter.
        Returns:
        a setter that will accept Objects, even though it is setting a field that isn't of type Object

      • genericGetter

        public FieldGetter<Object> genericGetter(String fieldName,
                                         FieldType expectedType)
        Creates a getter that fetches field values as Object for the given field name.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - name of the field
        expectedType - expected data type of the fetched field
        Returns:
        a getter that will fetch field as Object
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if the given expected data type of the field is not the same as the actual data type

      • fieldCopier

        public FieldCopier fieldCopier(AbstractTupleSchema srcSchema,
                               String[] srcFields,
                               String[] destFields)
        Create a new object for copying fields from one tuple to another.
        Parameters:
        srcSchema - schema of source tuples (destination tuples must be of this schema)
        srcFields - names of fields in the source tuples
        destFields - names of corresponding fields in the destination tuples
        Returns:
        FieldCopier the new object

      • fieldCopier

        public FieldCopier fieldCopier(AbstractTupleSchema srcSchema)
        Convenience method for copying all the fields of the source schema without changing their names.

        public String getLastSpanCol()
        Returns the name of the last field of type Span in the schema.
        Returns:
        name of the rightmost field of type span in the schema, or null if no such field exists

        public String getLastTextCol()
        Returns the name of the last field of type Text in the schema.
        Returns:
        name of the rightmost field of type Text in the schema, or null if no such field exists

public String getFirstTextCol()

        Returns the name of the first field of type Text in the schema.

        public String getLastTextOrSpanCol()
        Returns the name of the last Text or Span field in the schema.
        Returns:
        name of the rightmost field of type Text *or* Span in the schema, or null if no such field exists

        public int nameToIx(String fieldName)
        Returns the index of the given field name in the schema.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - field name
        Returns:
        index of the given field name in the schema
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if schema does not contain the given field name

      • unionCompatible

        public boolean unionCompatible(AbstractTupleSchema other)

        unionCompatible.

        Returns:
        true if tuples from this schema can be UNIONed safely with tuples from other

      • generalize

        public static TupleSchema generalize(ArrayList<? extends AbstractTupleSchema> schemas)
        Given a list of schemas that are compatible from the perspective of unionCompatible(AbstractTupleSchema), determine the most general schema that safely encompasses all types in the list.

        NOTE: This method must be kept in sync with unionCompatible(AbstractTupleSchema).

        Parameters:
        schemas - schemas to be combined together (usually as inputs to a union operator). Upstream code should have already verified union-compatibility of these schemas.
        Returns:
        most specific generalized schemas that the fields of the indicated schemas can be cast to

      • sameTupleFormat

        public boolean sameTupleFormat(AbstractTupleSchema otherSchema)
        Returns true if both schemas have their fields in the same positions and share the same data types.
        Parameters:
        otherSchema - another schema, which can be a base or derived schema
        Returns:
        true if both schemas put their fields in the same positions within the tuples

      • compareNamesAndTypes

        protected int compareNamesAndTypes(AbstractTupleSchema o)
        Compare the names and types of the fields in a schema, without reference to the underlying mapping to actual tuple fields.
        Returns:
        a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer as this schema sorts lower, equal to, or higher than the specified schema.
